text: "Everybody Loves a Nut" is a song written by Jack Clement and originally recorded by Johnny Cash on Columbia Records for his 1966 novelty album Everybody Loves a Nut. Released in May 1966 as the second single (Columbia 4-43673, with "Austin Prison" on the opposite side) from the yet-to-be- released album, the song became a U.S. country top-20 hit. == Background and critical response == In this song Cash "proclaim[s] that the world likes people a little off center and slightly weird." == Track listing == == Charts == {|class="wikitable sortable" !align="center"|Chart (1966) !align="center"|Peak position |- |- |} == References == == External links == * "Everybody Loves a Nut" on the Johnny Cash official website Category:Johnny Cash songs Category:1966 singles Category:Columbia Records singles Category:1966 songs Category:Songs written by Jack Clement Category:Country music songs Category:Novelty songs
title: Everybody Loves a Nut (song)
